paw_structure.radial¶

Radial distribution function calculation.

Dependencies:

functools matplotlib miniutils.progress_bar numpy pandas scipy pbc utility radial_c

radial_calculate(snapshots, id1, id2, cut, nbins)

Calculate the radial distribution function (rdf) including multiple snapshots.

radial_distance(center, pbc_atoms, cut)

Find distance values smaller than a cutoff distance.

radial_integrate(radius, rdf, rho)

Integration of radial distribution function (rdf).

radial_load(root[, ext])

Load information previously saved by radial_save().

radial_plot(radius, rdf[, integration])

Plot the radial distribution function (rdf) and the coordination number integration if selected.

radial_save(root, radius, rdf, coord, …[, ext])

Save results to file.

radial_single(snap, id1, id2, cut[, names])

Collect distances between all atoms of type id1 and type id2.

radial_single_c(snap, id1, id2, cut[, names])

Binding of C++ routines for distance calculation of a single snapshot.
paw_structure.radial.radial_calculate(snapshots, id1, id2, cut, nbins, names=None)¶

Calculate the radial distribution function (rdf) including multiple snapshots.

Note

Use of names is not implemented yet in the control file.

Parameters

  • snapshots (list[Snap]) – list of snapshots containing the atomic information

  • id1 (str) – identifier for atoms used as centers (e.g. ‘MN’, ‘O_’)

  • id2 (str) – identifier for atoms as possible neighbors (e.g. ‘O_’, ‘H_’)

  • cut (float) – cutoff distance for radial calculation

  • nbins (int) – number of radius intervals; influences resolutions together with cut

  • names (list[str], optional) – names of atoms to use as centers (e.g. ‘O_43’, ‘H_23’)

Returns

radii used for rdf calculation ndarray[float]: value of rdf corresponding to these radii ndarray[float]: value of coordination number corresponding to these radii float: average atom density of type id2

Return type

ndarray[float]

paw_structure.radial.radial_distance(center, pbc_atoms, cut)¶

Find distance values smaller than a cutoff distance.

Note

Not in use. Replaced by C++ routines.

Parameters

  • center (pandas.DataFrame) – central atom of reference

  • pbc_atoms (pandas.DataFrame) – atoms as possible neighbors

  • cut (float) – cutoff distance

Returns

distances found which are smaller than cutoff distance

Return type

ndarray[float]

paw_structure.radial.radial_integrate(radius, rdf, rho)¶

Integration of radial distribution function (rdf).

Uses scipy.cumtrapz() for numerical integration.

XXX REFERENCE TO COORDINATION NUMBER CALCULATION XXX

Parameters

  • radius (ndarray[float]) – radii used for rdf calculation

  • rdf (ndarray[float]) – value of rdf corresponding to these radii

  • rho (float) – average atom density of type id2

Returns

value of integration corresponding to the radii

Return type

ndarray[float]

paw_structure.radial.radial_load(root, ext='.radial')¶

Load information previously saved by radial_save().

Parameters

  • root (str) – root name for the file to be loaded

  • ext (str, optional) – default “.radial” - extension for the file to be loaded: name = root + ext

Returns

2D array containing radii, values of rdf and coordination number float: average atom density of type id2

Return type

ndarray(float)

paw_structure.radial.radial_plot(radius, rdf, integration=None)¶

Plot the radial distribution function (rdf) and the coordination number integration if selected.

Parameters

  • radius (ndarray[float]) – radii used for rdf calculation

  • rdf (ndarray[float]) – value of rdf corresponding to these radii

  • integration (ndarray[float], optional) – coordination number for different radii

Note

Implement better display of plot. Spawn subprocess to let the core program finish.

paw_structure.radial.radial_save(root, radius, rdf, coord, snapshots, id1, id2, cut, nbins, rho, ext='.radial')¶

Save results to file.

XXX REFERENCE TO EXPLANATION OF .radial FILE FORMAT

Parameters

  • root (str) – root name for saving file

  • radius (ndarray[float]) – radii used for rdf calculation

  • rdf (ndarray[float]) – value of rdf corresponding to these radii

  • coord (ndarray[float]) – coordination number obtained from integration of rdf

  • snapshots (list[Snap]) – list of snapshots containing the water complexes

  • id1 (str) – identifier for atoms used as centers (e.g. ‘MN’, ‘O_’)

  • id2 (str) – identifier for atoms as possible neighbors (e.g. ‘O_’, ‘H_’)

  • cut (float) – cutoff distance for radial calculation

  • nbins (int) – number of radius intervals; influences resolutions together with cut

  • rho (float) – average atom density of type id2

  • ext (str, optional) – default “.radial” - extension for the saved file: name = root + ext

paw_structure.radial.radial_single(snap, id1, id2, cut, names=None)¶

Collect distances between all atoms of type id1 and type id2. If names is given, those atoms are used as centers instead of id1.

Note

Not in use. Replaced by C++ routines.

Parameters

  • snap (Snap) – single snapshot containing the atomic information

  • id1 (str) – identifier for atoms used as center (e.g. ‘MN’, ‘O_’)

  • id2 (str) – identifier for atoms as possible neighbors (e.g. ‘O_’, ‘H_’)

  • cut (float) – cutoff distance for radial calculation

  • names (list[str], optional) – names of atoms to use as centers (e.g. ‘O_43’, ‘H_23’)

Returns

list of distances found which are smaller than cut

Return type

list[float]

paw_structure.radial.radial_single_c(snap, id1, id2, cut, names=None)¶

Binding of C++ routines for distance calculation of a single snapshot.

Parameters

  • snap (Snap) – single snapshot containing the atomic information

  • id1 (str) – identifier for atoms used as center (e.g. ‘MN’, ‘O_’)

  • id2 (str) – identifier for atoms as possible neighbors (e.g. ‘O_’, ‘H_’)

  • cut (float) – cutoff distance for radial calculation

  • names (list[str], optional) – names of atoms to use as centers (e.g. ‘O_43’, ‘H_23’)

Returns

list of distances found which are smaller than cut

Return type

list[float]
